Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Removable \Re*mov"a*ble\ (r?-m??v"?-b'l), a. Admitting of being removed. --Ayliffe. -- {Re*mov`a*bil"i*ty} (-?-b?l"?-t?), n. [1913 Webster]
removable adj 1: capable of being removed or taken away or dismissed; "a removable cord"; "removable partitions" [ant: {irremovable}] 2: able to be obliterated completely [syn: {obliterable}]
